item.title: spark joy
item.description: Working out how to Marie Kondo my blogdown workflow with categories and tags

item.title: hotkeys
item.description: There are some commands that as I get more and more familiar with Rstudio I find myself typing again and again. Keyboard shortcuts are helpful (disclaimer: these mac versions). Option-Command-i will open a new Rmarkdown code chunk. Option - is a handy way of typing assignment (<-) Shift-Command-M is a fast way of adding a pipe (%>%) A little googling and here is a whole list that I am yet to learn.
